titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Office of Media Production RG.7.3.4
titlestmt.author: University Archives staff. Additional description by Katie Ehrlich.

editionstmt.p: This version was ingested from an XML file in October 2008.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2026-01-22 18:47:32 UTC.

did.unittitle: Records of the Office of Media Production

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of Media Production

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of Media Production

did.abstract: The Office of Media Production was established to create digital communication strategies to advance recruitment, development and public relations. This collection of recordings include promotional material, commencement footage and documentary footage of speakers, visitors and events. Tapes range in date from 1983 to 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Repository permission is required for access. Please contact NYU Special Collections, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged into two series:

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of Media Production was established to create digital communication strategies to advance recruitment, development and public relations. It consults on, conceives, and produces video content for departments and schools for a variety of purposes. The office began in an informal capacity when Elisa Guarino began producing video works for the Office of the Vice President of External Affairs in the early 1980s. It became an official University operation circa 1987 and remained under External Affairs until NYU President John Sexton later brought the department under the auspices of the Office of University Relations and Public Affairs, which is responsible for portraying NYU's message, agenda, and image to external and internal audiences.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The videotapes in this collection were transferred in multiple accessions to the University Archives by the Office of Media Production, formerly under the authority of the Senior Vice President for External Affairs and presently reporting to the Senior Vice President for University Relations and Public Affairs. In November 2025, Nathan Townes-Anderson transferred an accretion of 118 Betacam SP tapes. The accession numbers associated with these transfers are 13.037, 14.049, 15.029, 2019.006, 2020.016, 2023.015, and 2025.043.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Access to some audiovisual materials in this collection is available through digitized access copies. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room.

Audiovisual materials that have not been preserved may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact the New York University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; The Office of Media Production Videotapes; RG 7.3.4; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2018 have not yet been recorded.

In 2019, audiovisual tapes from a new accession were added to the collection. Tapes were stored in appropriately-sized boxes and two hard drives were removed and recorded in Medialog, to be imaged at a later date, and then are to be returned to the Office of Media Production. Basic box-level descriptions were added to the end of the inventory.

In November 2025, an accretion of 118 Betacam SP tapes were rehoused in archival boxes, arranged into a separate series, described at the series-level, and inventoried at the item-level, re-purposing metadata from an inventory supplied by the donors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The audiovisual recordings in this collection contain promotional productions, University commencement ceremonies, lectures, panel discussions, and other events as well as B-roll footage of the NYU campus, study abroad sites and other New York City locations. The tapes comprise approximately 500 projects produced by the Office of Media Production.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact NYU Special Collections, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged by project number within each box or set of boxes.

altformavail.head: Digital surrogates available
altformavail.p: All of the audiovisual materials created as a part of this project have been digitized. Please contact the University Archives for information regarding access to digitized audiovisual materials.
